intro: Kedrostis rautanenii, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a spiny capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
